page.title: 11WILDLIFE IN OUR AREA
page.content: Most of area is famland, it is used for growing crops but you can still find areas with wildlife. One of the areas is Wickham Skeith Grimmer, this is a large pond on the village green. At the Grimmer there are frogs,they mate there. There are toads, they also mate.Ducks breed in the reeds too. You can sometimes see the babies on the lilies running around. There are some streams running through our area.Some of the children go dipping in them and we find some tiny fish, water beetles, freshwater shrimps, water boatmen and many kinds of larvae.This shows that the water is clean. At Stoke Ash School we made bird boxes. There are some nesting in them at the moment.We also have an invertebrate area there.
